title: Welcome!
content: This small graph is designed to teach graph structure using the same interactions you’ll use for larger graphs.

title: Start Here
content: Click nodes to open details. Hover nodes to highlight neighbors.

title: Graph Basics
content: These concepts explain what you’re seeing (nodes, edges, direction, weights, types).

title: Try Search
content: Open the menu and search for Task D or Leaf A1 to jump around.

title: Graph Structures
content: This node connects to multiple structure patterns below.

title: Tree
content: A hierarchy: root → branches → leaves. Great for categorization.

title: DAG
content: A dependency graph: edges flow forward with no cycles.

title: Cycle
content: A feedback loop. Sometimes useful, sometimes a circular-dependency bug.

title: Outcome
content: Follow the use-case nodes to reach the outcome summary.
